section.name: Training Material Index
section.p: The OSM Tutorials are provided with the aim of getting you up and operational as quickly as possible. The tutorials are loosly related to the DPML products Transit, Depot, Metro, and the Station server management platform - each representing a specific concern in Java based component development and application delivery.
The tutorial assumes you have downloaded and installed a JDK and the DPML SDK.

tr.td: This tutorial introduces the Transit resource managment system and takes you though examples of how you can improve your code by eliminating resource location and retrival concerns. The tutorial also present strategies concerning classloader construction, classloader chains, and plugin management solutions. This material will be of particular interest to developers and architects dealing with dynamically adaptive or runtime evolvable systems. This material is to some extent optional as is deals with the a general but low-level concern - however, a read through is recommended.

This tutorial focusses on the establishment of a production build environment using technologies that provide transitive dependency management. The tutorial presents the general setup of a build environment, examples of projects representing typical development needs, examples of the use of transitive dependencies in development and the generation of project data and runtime information. Readers will gain an understanding of the concerns related to build configuration, centralization of project information, strategies concerning test automation, and approaches to content publication and version management.

This tutorial is about the development of components using the IOC (Inversion of Control) principal. The tutorial takes you though the development, testing, and management of component solutions using the DPML Metro container. It presents a series of examples dealing with context driven IOC of simple though to complex composite components and strategies supporting effective component reuse. Feel free to start on this tutorial as it delivers the most value in terms of potential development productivity.

This tutorial is primarily concerned with the management of deployed applications. However, developers will find this material valuable relative to its coverage of remote component management of application clusters.
